enWisdom: Patience is the cornerstone of faith
The cornerstone of faith is patience
Patience is the fruit of conviction
Patience is the fruit of faith
Patience is an aide in every affair
Patience is the best of assets
Patience is the strongest vestment
Patience is a riding mount that does not stumble
Nobleness is having good patience [and tolerance]
Adversity [endured] with patience is the better of the two adversities
Patience is the most helpful thing in [facing the hardships of] one’s lifetime
Patience is the best of the believer’s soldiers
The first act of worship is waiting for relief with patience
Patience is a foundation [for other good actions]
The best of actions is that which fulfils the requirements
Patience is one of the two triumphs

Wisdom: الصَّبْرُ أَفْضَلُ سَجِيَّةٍ وَالْعِلْمُ أَشْرَفُ حِلْيَةٍ وَعَطِيَّةٍ
enWisdom: Patience is the best trait and knowledge is the most honourable embellishment and gift

Wisdom: الصَّبْرُ أَنْ يَحْتَمِلَ الرَّجُلُ مَا يَنُوبُهُ وَيَكْظِمَ مَا يُغْضِبُهُ
enWisdom: Patience is for a person to bear that which befalls him and to suppress [his anger with] that which enrages him

Wisdom: الصَّبْرُ أَحْسَنُ خلل [حُلَلِ‏] الْإِيمَانِ وَأَشْرَفُ خَلَائِقِ الْإِنْسَانِ
enWisdom: Patience is the best vestment of faith and the most honourable of human qualities

Wisdom: الْزَمُوا الصَّبْرَ فَإِنَّهُ دِعَامَةُ الْإِيمَانِ وَمِلَاكُ الْأُمُورِ
enWisdom: Espouse patience, for indeed it is the pillar of faith and the basis of affairs
The best patience is longanimity
The root of patience is [having] definite certainty about Allah
The action with most praiseworthy results is patience

Wisdom: إِنْ صَبَرْتَ جَرَى عَلَيْكَ الْقَلَمُ وَأَنْتَ مَأْجُورٌ وَإِنْ جَزِعْتَ جَرَى عَلَيْكَ الْقَلَمُ وَأَنْتَ مَأْزُورٌ
enWisdom: If you are patient then things will transpire as ordained and you will be rewarded, and if you are agitated then things will transpire as ordained and you will bear the burden of sin

Wisdom: إِنْ صَبَرْتَ صَبْرَ الْأَحْرَارِ وَإِلَّا سَلَوْتَ سُلُوَّ الْأَغْمَارِ [الْأَعْمَارِ]
enWisdom: Either be patient like the freemen or else seek distraction [and forget] like the inept

Wisdom: إِنْ صَبَرْتَ صَبْرَ الْأَكَارِمِ وَإِلَّا سَلَوْتَ سُلُوَّ الْبَهَائِمِ
enWisdom: Either be patient like the honourable ones or else seek distraction like the animals
The reward for patience is the loftiest reward

Wisdom: حُسْنُ الصَّبْرِ عَوْنٌ عَلَى كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
enWisdom: Good patience is an aide in every matter
Good patience is the basis of every affair
The adornment of religion is patience and contentment
Overcome anxiety with patience

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ جَعَلَ الصَّبْرَ مَطِيَّةَ نَجَاتِهِ وَالتَّقْوَى عُدَّةَ وَفَاتِهِ
enWisdom: Blessed is the one who makes patience the conveyance of his salvation and piety the provision of his death

Wisdom: رَحِمَ اللَّهُ امْرَأً جَعَلَ الصَّبْرَ مَطِيَّةَ حَيَاتِهِ وَالتَّقْوَى عُدَّةَ وَفَاتِهِ
enWisdom: May Allah have mercy on the person who makes patience the conveyance of his life and piety the provision for his death
Per during patience is the quality of the virtuous

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالصَّبْرِ فَإِنَّهُ حِصْنٌ حَصِينٌ وَعِبَادَةُ الْمُوقِنِينَ
enWisdom: Espouse patience, for indeed it is a protective fortress and the worship of those who possess certitude

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالصَّبْرِ فَبِهِ يَأْخُذُ الْعَاقِلُ وَإِلَيْهِ يَرْجِعُ الْجَاهِلُ
enWisdom: Espouse patience, for the intelligent one holds on to it and the ignorant one returns to it

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِلُزُومِ الصَّبْرِ فَبِهِ يَأْخُذُ الْحَازِمُ وَإِلَيْهِ يَئُولُ الْجَازِعُ
enWisdom: Espouse patience, for the judicious one holds on to it and the agitated one turns back to it

Wisdom: عِنْدَ الصَّدْمَةِ الْأُولَى يَكُونُ صَبْرُ النُّبَلَاءِ
enWisdom: It is during the first blow [of adversity] that the patience of the noble ones is seen
Sometimes patience becomes difficult [to come by]

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُنْجِهِ الصَّبْرُ أَهْلَكَهُ الْجَزَعُ
enWisdom: One who remains patient with the bitter harassment [of people] has demonstrated true piety
One who awaits a [positive] outcome is patient

Wisdom: مَنْ تَوَالَتْ عَلَيْهِ نَكَبَاتُ الزَّمَانِ اكْتَسَبَتْهُ فَضِيلَةُ الصَّبْرِ
enWisdom: One who faces successive calamities acquires the merit of patience through them

Wisdom: مَا صَبَرْتَ عَنْهُ خَيْرٌ مِمَّا الْتَذَذْتَ بِهِ
enWisdom: That which you abstain from is better than that which you delight in

Wisdom: مَا أَحْسَنَ بِالْإِنْسَانِ أَنْ يَصْبِرَ عَمَّا يَشْتَهِي
enWisdom: How good it is for a person to refrain from that which he desires!
How good a supporter patience is!
Do not let greed overpower your patience
There is no faith like patience
There is no aide better than patience

Wisdom: لَا يَتَحَقَّقُ الصَّبْرُ إِلَّا بِمُقَاسَاةِ ضِدِّ الْمَأْلُوفِ
enWisdom: Patience (or virtue) is not realized except by experiencing the pain of going against what one is accustomed to [and enjoys]
